instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No display
threads.message:
Hi.

This board has liquid damage on <CAPACITOR>C6412</CAPACITOR> with damage also on <CAPACITOR>C6432</CAPACITOR>. The fan will spin up 3 times before staying on when power is applied. Also I have 1.65V on CPUVCORE.
No display. Missing <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_OR_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> on pin 1 <RESISTOR>R8319</RESISTOR>. PP5VS4 is present. Checked <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> and I have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> on pin 8. Not sure what I should be getting on pins 5 & 6 to enable
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_OR_PSR_EN</SIGNAL>.
Known good display connected.

Also I will add that I when I plug in USB mouse it will light up as long as its only plugged in half way (like up to the prongs on the port of the board). If I plug in all the way, lights out. This is true as well on the other USB on IO board.

Tried to PRAM but don't think it actually worked. Plus I wouldnt be able to hear it chime anyway due to most likely the lack of audio since that is were the only damage is evident.


Thanks. Have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No display
threads.message: That sounds like a bad CPU. <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> present? Any corrosion near SMC, clock chip, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> originally?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No display
threads.message: The fan should not do on/off at all. This board is not booting. Check the usual suspects, J6100/<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and resistor/traces/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP>/crap under SMC. Is CPU Vcore even present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No display
threads.message:
Yes, I have 1.65V on CPU Vcore.

Will check other recommendations.

Thanks guys.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No display
threads.message:
All 3437 and 00165 boards I have worked on do cycle the fan 3 times after power is added back (once they are fixed). Unless everything is plugged in. 
When bench testing they only start up after the 3rd spin up. About 10-15 second. Apples repair guide even mentions that these and retinas will take up to 20 seconds to boot after battery reconnection.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No display
threads.message: Please don't give false advice! 00165 board DO NOT power cycle 3x. Only 3437/3435 do that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No display
threads.message:
Hey.

CPU turned out to be bad even though I had <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL>.


Thanks for everyones input, I appreciate it.

Have a good one day/night.
